# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text::AbstractString; text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    result = ""
    line_length = 0
    for word in words
        if line_length + length(word) > text_width
            result *= "\n$word "
            line_length = length(word) + 1
        else
            result *= "$word "
            line_length += length(word) + 1
        end
    end
    return result
end

text = "This is an example of wrapping a string in Julia"
println(wrap_string(text, text_width=10))
```
This will output:
```
This is an
example of
wrapping a
string in
Julia 
```
